三大疾病: (さんだいしっぺい) - three major diseases (cancer, cerebral stroke, acute myocardial infarction)
三大節: (さんだいせつ) - the three grand national holidays (Prayer to the Four Quarters, Empire Day, the Emperor's Birthday; pre-1927)
三大都市: (さんだいとし) - the three largest cities
三学: (さんがく) - threefold training; three divisions of the noble eightfold path
三宝: (さんぽう) - three treasures of Buddhism: Buddha, sutras and priesthood
三宝柑: (サンポウカン) - sanbokan sour orange (Citrus sulcata)
三宝荒神: (さんぼうこうじん) - guardian deity of Buddha, the sutras and the sangha; three-person saddle
三宮: (さんぐう) - Grand Empress Dowager, the Empress Dowager and the Empress Consort
三家: (さんけ) - three noble families (Kan'in, Kazan'in, and Nakanoin or Koga); three branch Tokugawa families (Owari, Kii, and Mito)
三密: (さんみつ) - three mysteries (Buddha's body, speech and mind)
三寒四温: (さんかんしおん) - (yoji) alternation of three cold and four warm days
三審制度: (さんしんせいど) - three-tiered court system; principle of a three-instance trial process
三寸: (さんずん) - three sun (ca. 9.1 cm); something small, short or thin (roughly the size of three sun); stall-keeper/huckster/hawker; prostitute of the lowest rank
三封: (さんぷう) - forced out on third
三尊: (さんそん) - (さんぞん only)   image of the three honorable ones (honourable); (さんぞん only)   Buddha, sutras and priesthood; (さんぞん only)  head and shoulders (stock price, etc. chart pattern); the three people one must esteem: master, father, teacher
三尊仏: (さんぞんぶつ) - image of the three honorable (honourable) ones
三尊天井: (さんぞんてんじょう) - head and shoulders (chartist pattern)
三尸: (さんし) - the three worms (in Taoism, worms that inhabit the human gut and, on the eve of the 57th day of the sexagenary cycle, ascend to heaven during one's sleep to report on one's wrongdoings)
三尺: (さんじゃく) - 3 Japanese feet; waistband; belt; cloth girdle
三尺さがって師の影を踏まず: (さんじゃくさがってしのかげをふまず) - (proverb)  a student must never forget to honor their teacher (honour)
三尺の秋水: (さんじゃくのしゅうすい) - sharpened sword
三尺の童子: (さんじゃくのどうじ) - mere child
三尺下がって師の影を踏まず: (さんじゃくさがってしのかげをふまず) - (proverb)  a student must never forget to honor their teacher (honour)
三尺去って師の影を踏まず: (さんじゃくさってしのかげをふまず) - (proverb) a student must never forget to honor their teacher (honour)
三尺帯: (さんじゃくおび) - waistband; belt; cloth girdle; obi
三山: (さんざん) - three mountains; three shrines (of Kumano); three kingdoms (of 14th- and 15th-century Okinawa)
三岐代表: (さんぎだいひょう) - representative of Gifu and Mie prefectures
三差路: (さんさろ) - three-forked road; junction of three roads
三帯アルマジロ: (ミツオビアルマジロ) - Brazilian three-banded armadillo (Tolypeutes tricinctus)
三幅一対: (さんぷくいっつい) - set of three
三幅対: (さんぷくつい) - set of three
三平方の定理: (さんへいほうのていり) - Pythagorean theorem
三平汁: (さんぺいじる) - soup with rice bran pickled or salted vegetables (e.g. carrots, daikon or potatoes) and fish (e.g. salmon, gadid or Arabesque greenling) boiled in a salty broth (sake lees is sometimes added) (Hokkaido local specialty dish)
三府鶉: (ミフウズラ) - barred button quail (Turnix suscitator)
三度: (みたび) - three times/thrice; (さんど only) third (musical interval); (みたび only) several times/often/frequently
三度のめしよりすき: (さんどのめしよりすき) - very fond of; more fond of than eating; so fond of that someone would rather not eat than go without; more important than three meals a day
三度のめしより好き: (さんどのめしよりすき) - very fond of; more fond of than eating; so fond of that someone would rather not eat than go without; more important than three meals a day
三度の和音: (さんどのわおん) - common chord; triad
三度の食事: (さんどのしょくじ) - daily meals; three regular meals a day
三度の食事より好き: (さんどのしょくじよりすき) - very fond of; more fond of than eating; so fond of that someone would rather not eat than go without; more important than three meals a day
三度の飯より好き: (さんどのめしよりすき) - very fond of; more fond of than eating; so fond of that someone would rather not eat than go without; more important than three meals a day
三度三度: (さんどさんど) - three times a day (of meals)
三度入り: (さんどいり) - medium-sized earthenware sake cup
三度目の正直: (さんどめのしょうじき) - third time lucky; third time's the charm
三度笠: (さんどがさ) - type of traditional Japanese conical hat
三度豆: (さんどまめ) - (because harvested three times per year)  common bean; pea (Fukushima, Niigata pref.)
三役: (さんやく) - three highest ranks (wrestling, unions, etc.); three parts/three divisions
三役揃い踏み: (さんやくそろいぶみ) - {sumo} ritual stomping in unison on the final day of a tournament
三役格: (さんやくかく) - {sumo} referee officiating bouts of san'yaku ranked wrestlers
三徳: (さんとく) - three primary virtues: valour, wisdom and benevolence (valor)
三徳包丁: (さんとくぼうちょう) - all-purpose kitchen knife; santoku knife
三悪: (さんまく) - the world of hungry spirits and the world of animals/three evil worlds hell; (さんあく only) three evils (e.g. prostitution, drugs and venereal diseases)
三悪趣: (さんまくしゅ) - the world of hungry spirits and the world of animals; three evil worlds hell
三悪道: (さんまくどう) - the world of hungry spirits and the world of animals; three evil worlds hell
三態: (さんたい) - the three phases of matter: solid, liquid and gas
三懸: (さんがい) - headstall, martingale, and crupper
三所攻め: (みところぜめ) - {sumo} triple attack force out
三手楓: (ミツデカエデ) - ivy-leaved maple (Acer cissifolium)
三才: (さんさい) - the three powers: heaven, earth and man
三拍子: (さんびょうし) - {music} triple time; three important requisites
三拍子そろう: (さんびょうしそろう) - meeting all three important conditions; being a triple threat; being ideal
三拍子揃う: (さんびょうしそろう) - meeting all three important conditions; being a triple threat; being ideal
三拝: (さんぱい) - adoration which is performed three times or repeatedly; act of worship which is performed three times or repeatedly
三拝九拝: (さんぱいきゅうはい) - (yoji) kowtowing; bowing repeatedly
三指樹懶: (ミユビナマケモノ) - three-toed sloth
三振: (さんしん) - {baseb} strikeout; strike out; fanning out
三振法: (さんしんほう) - three strikes law (US)
三掛: (さんがい) - headstall, martingale, and crupper
三損友: (さんそんゆう) - three kinds of bad friends (sycophantic, insincere, and glib)
三摩耶: (さまや) - time (san: samaya); meeting/coming together; equality, warning, or riddance of hindrances (esp. in esoteric Buddhism as vows of the buddhas and bodhisattvas)
三摩耶形: (さまやぎょう) - object or shape that symbolizes the vow of a buddha or bodhisattva to save all life
三摩耶戒: (さんまやかい) - precepts given to an adherent prior to being consecrated as an Acharya (in esoteric Buddhism)
三教: (さんきょう) - Shinto, Buddhism and Confucianism
三文判: (さんもんばん) - ready-made seal; cheap seal
三文小説: (さんもんしょうせつ) - (yoji) dime novel
三文役者: (さんもんやくしゃ) - (yoji) third-rate actor
三斑鶉: (ミフウズラ) - barred button quail (Turnix suscitator)
三方: (さんぽう) - three sides; small offering stand
三族: (さんぞく) - three types of relatives (e.g. father, children and grandchildren; parents, siblings, wife and children; etc.)
三族の罪: (さんぞくのつみ) - crime for which one's three types of relatives will be punished; crime implicating one's relatives of all three types
三日: (みっか) - the third day of the month; three days
三日とあげず: (みっかとあげず) - almost every day; constantly
三日と上げず: (みっかとあげず) - almost every day; constantly
